articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: May 27, 2025 3:50 a.m. Roseburg is expected to see afternoon high temperatures well above normal through Saturday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the Umpqua Valley will experience sunny dry conditions all week. Forecasters said there is no decent chance of rain until...
articles.title: ROSEBURG EXPECTED TO SEE HIGHS WELL ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH SATURDAY

articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: May 27, 3:30 a.m. Wildlife Safari has introduced Muhimu, a two-year-old male giraffe who recently arrived from Fresno, California. A safari release said Muhimu is currently settling into his new home and is being gradually introduced to the rest of the giraffe herd, which includes Konza, Jact, Raza, Margie and Watson. One of Wildlife Safari’s...
articles.title: WILDLIFE SAFARI INTRODUCES NEW GIRAFFE MUHIMU

articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: May 27, 2025 3:20 a.m. Roseburg High School has announced its graduation information. Senior checkouts begin on June 2nd. All fines and fees must be paid, all signatures from teachers need to be gathered, and locker cleanout takes place that week. June 4th is the last day of instruction for seniors with checkout forms due....
articles.title: ROSEBURG HIGH SCHOOL ANNOUNCES GRADUATION INFORMATION

articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: May 27, 2025 3:05 a.m. Roseburg Public Library has its Summer Reading Program for children and teens beginning on June 1st. The program will continue through Saturday August 23rd. That is 12 weeks and equates to 57 programs, hundreds of reading prizes, 290 craft kits every week, numerous outreach events, and extra summer volunteers and...
articles.title: SUMMER READING PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN/TEENS STARTS IN JUNE

articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: May 27, 2025 2:50 a.m. Oregon’s U.S. Senators Jeff Merkley and Ron Wyden, alongside U.S. Representative Val Hoyle are calling for swift approval of Governor Tina Kotek’s request for a Major Disaster Declaration from the Federal Emergency Management Agency. A joint release said the push comes in response to devastating flood and other damaging weather-related...
articles.title: MERKLEY, WYDEN, HOYLE PUSH FOR FEDERAL DISASTER DECLARATION

F-15 Eagle fighter jets are scheduled to conduct flyovers at the following community locations at, or around, the designated times on Monday, May 26, 2025. 10:55 a.m. Veteran’s Park, Klamath...

articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: May 26, 2025 6:10 a.m. Monday is Memorial Day and there are a number of closures. Federal, state, county and city offices and buildings will not be open. Regular mail is not being delivered. Schools are not in session. Banks and credit unions remain closed. Some retail stores will be closed or are operating on...
articles.title: MEMORIAL DAY CLOSURES

articles.description: May 26, 2025 6:00 a.m. A number of events are being held Monday to remember the thousands of people who have made the ultimate sacrifice by giving their life for the nation. articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: May 25, 2025 6:45 a.m. Crews with the Douglas Forest Protective Association have the Doe Hollow Fire 25 percent mopped up, as of late Saturday afternoon. DFPA Acting Public Information Officer Nic Freeman said the goal is to have the fire 100 mopped up by the end of the weekend. Freeman said three type 6...

articles.description: Over Memorial Day Weekend, airplanes whizzed through the skies above the Roseburg Regional Airport, engaging in complex aerobatics, high-speed races and even head-to-head aerial combat. Well, miniature airplanes that is.

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
In a significant move to strengthen domestic manufacturing and reduce reliance on foreign supply chains, the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) has launched the “Make Onshoring Great Again” portal. This free, searchable database connects small businesses with over one million verified U.S. manufacturers, producers, and suppliers, aiming to revitalize American industry and support economic recovery.…
The post SBA Unveils ‘Make Onshoring Great Again’ Portal to Bolster U.S. Manufacturing and Economic Resilience appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: SBA Unveils ‘Make Onshoring Great Again’ Portal to Bolster U.S. Manufacturing and Economic Resilience

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
Imagine what it would be like if your business had no constraints placed upon it. That is, no lack of addressable market, no lack of capital, no lack of talent and imagination to drive wonderful results on a continuing basis. Wouldn’t that be something to experience? In some respects, isn’t this what you are working…
The post Dealing With Constraints appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Dealing With Constraints

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: F-15 jets from the 173rd Fighter Wing will perform Memorial Day flyovers across southern Oregon on Monday, May 26, to honor fallen service members. Locations include Klamath Falls, Roseburg, Reedsport, Gold Beach, Brookings, Grants Pass, and Eagle Point.
articles.title: 173rd Fighter Wing holding Memorial Day flyovers for Southern Oregon

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Fire crews responded to the 45-acre Doe Hollow Fire near Days Creek on May 22. DFPA engines, a dozer, and contract crews are working the scene. The cause remains under investigation. Official mapping and full containment efforts are ongoing.
articles.title: DFPA Responds to 45-Acre Doe Hollow Fire Near Days Creek
